com.cloudant.sync.replication

Class Replication.Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudant.sync.replication.Replication.Filter
  • Enclosing class:
    Replication
    Deprecated. 
    Use PullFilter instead

    @Deprecated
public static class Replication.Filter
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides the name and parameters for a filter function to be used when a pull replication calls the source database's _changes feed.

    For a filter function that takes no parameters, use this constructor:

     Filter filter = new Filter("filterDoc/filterFunctionName")

    For a filter function that requires parameters, use this constructor:

     Map<String, String> params = new HashMap();
 map.put("max_age", "10");
 map.put("name", "john");
 Filter filter = new Filter("doc/filterName", map);
    See Also:
    PullReplication, Controlling documents replicated, Filter functions CouchDB docs

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public final java.lang.String name
        Deprecated. 
        The name of the filter function to use.

        The name attribute is the name of the filter, as passed to the filter parameter of CouchDB's _changes feed. This is the name of the design document, minus the leading _design/, and the name of the filter function, separated by a slash. For example, filterDoc/filterFunctionName.

      • parameters

        public final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters
        Deprecated. 
        Any parameters required for the function. Can be null.

        The contents of properties are expanded to key=value pairs when constructing the _changes feed call for the remote database. Integer values should be added as String objects.

        See Also:
        Filter functions CouchDB docs

    • Constructor Detail

      • Filter

        public Filter(java.lang.String filterName)
        Deprecated. 
        Constructs a filter object for a function that requires no parameters.
        Parameters:
        filterName - filter function name

      • Filter

        public Filter(java.lang.String filterName,
              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Deprecated. 

        Constructs a filter object for a function requiring parameters.

        The query parameters should not be URL-escaped.

        Parameters:
        filterName - filter function name
        parameters - filter function parameters

    • Method Detail

      • toQueryString

        public java.lang.String toQueryString()
        Deprecated. 

        Generate a string representation of this Filter object that is consistent for a given name and parameter set.

        The string is not intended for use in URLs as it's not escaped.

        Filter parameters are sorted by key so that the generated String are the same for different calls. This is important because the String can therefore be part of the replication ID.

        Returns:
        Query string like representation of the filter
        See Also:
        BasicPullStrategy.getReplicationId()
